customData.content: 57-year-old Chinese man admitted to the respiratory department for hemoptysis and cough. Denies chest pain, fever, shiver, and other concomitant symptoms. Social history: 60-pack year smoking history and 30 years of significant alcohol intake, sober for 10 years. No other relevant medical history of note.

HPI.summary: 57-year-old Chinese man admitted for hemoptysis and cough.

social_history.description: 30 years of significant alcohol intake, sober for 10 years

customData.content: Patient has no known genetic, congenital, or developmental abnormalities. No prior treatment for current symptoms. Physical exam: superficial lymph nodes non-palpable/enlarged, clear breathing sounds bilaterally without crackles.

physical_exam.finding: clear breathing sounds bilaterally without crackles

customData.content: CT scan (2020-10-12) revealed an irregular large soft tissue mass (52.85 mm) in the right hilar region, invading the right main bronchus, narrowing, and truncating with atelectasis.

imaging.finding: Irregular large soft tissue mass (52.85 mm) in the right hilar region, invading the right main bronchus, narrowing, and truncating with atelectasis.

customData.content: Histological examination of a transbronchial specimen confirmed squamous cell carcinoma (SCC). No lymph node metastases or distant organ metastases were identified.

imaging.impression: No lymph node metastases or distant organ metastases were identified.

customData.content: Diagnosis of right central lung SCC with right upper lobe atelectasis (stage cT3N0M0, IIB).

diagnoses.label: Atelectasis of upper lobe of right lung

imaging.finding: Atelectasis of upper lobe of right lung
imaging.impression: Atelectasis of upper lobe of right lung

customData.content: Treatment plan: induction chemotherapy with sequential thoracic radiotherapy. Induction chemotherapy regimen: Paclitaxel (albumin-bound) 400 mg D1 combined with carboplatin 500 mg D1 on a 21-day cycle.
After two cycles of chemotherapy, efficacy was evaluated as stable disease (Figure 1B).

data.content: Transition from initial presentation to physical exam findings. No known genetic, congenital, or developmental abnormalities. Physical exam: superficial lymph nodes non-palpable/enlarged, clear breathing sounds bilaterally without crackles.

Transition to CT scan results. CT scan (2020-10-12) revealed an irregular large soft tissue mass (52.85 mm) in the right hilar region, invading the right main bronchus, narrowing, and truncating with atelectasis.

Transition from imaging to histological examination. Histological examination of a transbronchial specimen confirmed squamous cell carcinoma (SCC). No lymph node metastases or distant organ metastases were identified.
Transition to final diagnosis. Diagnosis of right central lung SCC with right upper lobe atelectasis (stage cT3N0M0, IIB).

Transition to treatment plan. Treatment plan: induction chemotherapy with sequential thoracic radiotherapy. Induction chemotherapy regimen: Paclitaxel (albumin-bound) 400 mg D1 combined with carboplatin 500 mg D1 on a 21-day cycle.
Transition to start of first treatment cycle. First treatment cycle began on 2020-10-16.
Transition to efficacy evaluation after two cycles of chemotherapy. After two cycles of chemotherapy, efficacy was evaluated as stable disease (Figure 1B).
